Armory: A fortified room were weapons and armors are stored at.
A building dedicated to the creation of baked goods.
A smelly room filled with guards awaiting for an assignment.
Thick curtain walls that surround the castle buildings like a strong shield.
Prisoners are thrown in these dark cells awaiting for a judgement to be passed onto them.
Hidden tunnel which leads to the outside of the castle.
Towers usually built as a part of the curtain wall.
This hot forge is used to constanty produce weapons and armors for the soldiers.
Magnificant chambers dedicated to the nobility.
A large hall designated for the lord to pass judgements to the commoners.
The finests meals are prepared in these kitchens for the nearby nobility.
Stone boxes with holes used for dropping stones on attackers.
A shallow moat filled with water in order to slow down the attackers.
Openings in the ceiling in front of the gate in order to drop hot liquids down to the attackers.
A small shack reserved for the castle priest.
A hall filled with the finest knights this county has ever seen.
Stables used to store the warhorses.
An imposing keep made out of stone.
A room filled with supplies needed to survive a long siege.
A small arena used to drill troops into shape.
The city apothecary can be found mixing ingredients in this shack.
Three chairs are situated in the corner of this room for the local barber to use.
This building is utilized in the making of beer.
Shady figures are seen entering and exiting this building filled with prostitutes.
The local carpenter can be found creating wood platforms for the galleys.
A lonely hut utilized for charcoal burning.
A church giving faith to the city habitants.
A small stand utilized by the local cobbler in mending broken shoes needing repair.
A sea zone reserved for the storing of ships.
Huge tracts of land reserved for agriculture.
An inn offering a place to rest for people passing by.
Many stands can be found gathering around the town center during market days.
An outdoor location dedicated to the making of stonework.
Land used to feed the local pasture.
Big windmills are used to grind grain into flour.
A sea zone reserved for the building and repairing of ships.
A local tavern used to generate income from the thirsty peasants.
The center of the city were the mayor is located at.
A grand university were the rich burghers and nobility can gain an education.
A huge building used to store various raw materials.
A small shack reserved for the creation of arrows.
Various brimstones scattered around the outside fort in order to slow down the enemy movement.
Various caltrops scattered around the outside fort in order to slow down the enemy movement.
An impressive tent set aside for the commanding general.
Increased number of tents which allow for more troops to be stationed here.
Forager huts are set aside for the collection of local fruits and vegetables.
Proper hitchings posts which allow for cavalry to be stationed here.
Various oil pits scattered around the outside fort which can be ignated in case of an attack.
A small palisade located around the outer main wall.
The quartermaster is in charge of the distribution of meals and handing out the necessary provisions.
A dug out trench which is designate to slow down attackers.
A small inner stone wall reinforcement applied to the main wall.
A few large tents set aside for the army's elites.
Marked spots which spearmen can position themselves in case of an attack.
Various spike traps scattered around the outside fort which are hidden from the attackers.
Various stakes scattered around the outside fort in order to impale the enemy cavalry.
A supply tent which stores the local army's supplies.
A few training dummies installed near the fort walls which troops can use to practice with.
A large watchtower located near the fort entrance.
A small wooden barbican located right outside of the fort's gate.
An office were all the family's advisors meet to have discussions.
A private art collection showing off the family's wealth.
Quarters set aside for the family Chancellor.
Quarters set aside for the family Chaplain.
A workshop dedicated to the construction of crossbows.
A tall grass maze located in the back of the palace.
An upgraded framework for the royal palace.
A room which is used by the family ships to plan long sea voyages.
Quarters set aside for the family Marshal.
A quiet and secluded room utilized for prayers.
Soldiers of fortune contracted by the family to assist in their disputes.
A minting facility used to mint new coins.
A workshop dedicated to the construction of poleaxes.
Grounds were the newborn family members learn how to ride a horse.
Royal guards swore to protect the family.
Royal guards swore to protect the family palace.
Quarters set aside for the family Spymaster.
Quarters set aside for the family Steward.
An underground room containing all the family riches.
A wine cellar often utilized by for love affairs.
A stand utilized by the hospital to display lepers and the sick in order to generate some revenue from entertainment.
A secluded hut located in the outskirts of the hospital used by the local alchemist.
A room filled with dusty treatment books.
A room used to dissect the dead in order to further study the human body.
A small chapel located inside the hospital.
A room filled with board games and chess pieces.
A garden located at the front of the hospital.
Healers can be found attending to the sick in these welcoming rooms.
Cells housing patients awaiting for an exorcism.
These colonies house all the lepers of this province.
Aspiring healers receive their education in this academy.
An oval office located at the top of the hospital were astrological observations can be made.
Weary travelers can be found entering and exiting this building constantly.
These docks are used to catalog and welcome new immigrants to the province.
A small building were the non-critical patients are housed at.
Soup kitchens which are used to feed the ill.
Patients in critical conditions are typically rushed to this room.
A room used by the local tailor to produce linen for the patients beds.
A place were foreign refugees can communicate with the locals.
A deep stone well located in the back of the hospital.
Large jugs of fermented milk are stored for usage during celebrations.
Tents used to fabricate the clan's armors.
An enclosed field with various spikes surrounding the encampment.
Enclosed pens utilized for the breeding of cattle.
The biggest yurt located in the center of the encampment.
Enclosed pens which house various goats.
Enclosed pens utilized for the breeding of horses.
Enclosed pens which house various horses.
A tent containing various meats hanging from the ceiling with metal hooks.
Wood is carved here in order to create various musical instruments.
Huge animals with the sole purposes of dragging wagons around.
An outdoor location dedicated to the making of stonework.
Enclosed pens which house various sheep.
A yurt used to store local supplies.
Stones are chipped here in order to create various figurines.
Tents used to fabricate the clan's weapons.
Enclosed pits used to practice wrestling.
A relay post which is used to send and receive messages.
A sprawling village filled with the clan's residents.
A round enclosed field were people compete for fame and glory.
A forge dedicated to the creation of shields and armors.
An underground storage for weapons and armors.
A large room were the chief resolves all the disputes happening in the realm.
Land set aside for agricultural purposes.
Various fishing huts located near the nearby river.
A store providing bows for the village's hunters.
A spacious hall were only the strongest warriors are allowed to reside.
Horse pens were the village's mounts are stored at.
Hunters utilize this facility after catching some game.
A loud kennel were wardogs are trained in the arts of warfare.
An essential building were all warriors gather to drink after a successful raid.
A wharf dedicated to the construction of military vessels.
Raised earthwork accompanied by an enclosed courtyard surrounded by a protective ditch and palisade.
A round field were archers can practice their marksmanship skills.
A shrine dedicated to the worship of a deity.
The location were all the warriors gather and prepare for war.
A forge dedicated to the creation of weapons.
A wooden keep overlooking the nearby courtyard.
A spiked wooden barrier which is lowered by chains from a chamber above the gateway.
A small house were alms are given out.
The house of the ruling bishop.
The resting place of the local clergy.
A wooden drawbridge used to allow people inside the temple.
A dry moat used to slow down attackers.
A small fishing village located outside the temple.
A building set aside for the accomodations of wandering pilgrims.
Barracks housing the local warriors of the faith.
This infirmary allows priests to cure the sick in an enclosed environment.
Uneducated peasants tending to the temple's farmland are located in this building.
A large library were scriptures are stored.
The main building of the temple were rituals are performed.
Dark cells used by sinners in order to cleanse themselves of sins.
Sacred roads leading to the local shrine.

A tall stone wall which surrounds the local temple.
A building used to make and store wine.
An immense bank combined with an impenetrable fort.

Visitors coming via sea are required to pass by this house before being allowed inside.
A building were cargo is stored at.
A farm specializing in the cultivation of exotic fruits.
A building used to clean fish.

Retinues hired by the realm's lord to protect the trade post.
A hidden cavern utilized in the smuggling of illegal goods.
A toll booth located in the intersection of the nearby road.
A trade office were merchants can exchange goods before continuing on their journey.
A port utilized exclusevely for trade.

Armory: This is where the elite infantry serving a Jewish ruler is trained. Special care is taken to equip the soldiers with the finest heavy armor that money can buy. This, combined with rigorous training and iron discipline, makes them an elite force to be truly feared.
x: C’est là que l’infanterie d’élite au service d’un seigneur juif s’entraîne. Une attention spéciale est donnée pour équiper les soldats avec les meilleures armures lourdes qui puissent être achetées. Cela, combiné avec l’entraînement rigoureux et une discipline de fer, font de ces soldats une terrifiante force d’élite.
column6: Aquí es donde se entrena la infantería de élite que sirve a los señores judios. Se pone especial atención en equipar a los soldados con la mejor armadura que el dinero pueda comprar. Combinado esto con el entrenamiento riguroso y la disciplina férrea, hacen que estas fuerzas de élite sean realmente temidas.

Armory: The “Campus Martius” (or field of mars) is where military training for legionaries is carried out. Traditionally the training consisted of using training weapons that were much heavier than the actual weapon. The recruits place a stake in the training field and attack it as if it were an enemy. Commoners will generally come and spurn the young men on with cheering as well.

Armory: Forts with a command post increase the size of local garrison, troop morale and provide a seat for one additional commander.
A ditch is an obstacle, designed to slow down or break up an attacking force. Upgrading the ditch will increase the fort level.
A moat is a deep, broad ditch, filled with water, that surrounds the fort, and provides it with a preliminary line of defence.

A moat is a deep, broad ditch, filled with water, that surrounds the fort, and provides it with a preliminary line of defence. Combined with a drawbridge it makes access to the fort nearly impossible.
Archer Tower provides a higher ground for archers defending a fortification. With further upgrades, number of archers and their strength is increased.

Armory: This is a small but vibrant trading post.
This trading post's prosperity has allowed it to grow into a large town, offering more protection against raiders and brigands and thus attracting more merchants who prefer to stay here and trade.

This is a major trading hub, where merchants come from all directions to trade their wares. All goods and services known to civilized man can be found here, and a myriad of languages echo through the many streets and alleys.

Armory: This building collects duties from passing traders
By expanding the structure we can more effectively collect duties
With further expansions to the building, as well as improvements in the bureaucracy itself, we can squeeze the maximum potential duties out of the traders
Small Garrison to protect a trade post
Garrison to protect a trade post with regular patrols to guard the route
Large Garrison to protect the route with regular patrols and watchtowers along the way
The majestic Cathedral of Aachen proudly looks over its city. It is a sign of powerful realm ruled by even more powerful ruler.
These ancient reminders of long lost civilization bring many wonderers here.
This rock-cut city was abandoned after an earthquake struck it many centuries ago, but it can still teach us many things about architecture.
Massive walls that protect the city against any foes.
Former northern border of the mighty Roman Empire that can still be used against enemies.
This walled city serves as a showcase of power and influence, aswell as a wealth of a strong realm.
Physicians will setup a detached hospital ward near a trade post and examine all incoming traders. Should it be necessary they will be placed into isolation before being allowed into the city.
All incoming ships will be isolated for some time before being allowed to dock at the trade post.
Small Estates provide prestige and a steady income.
The peoples of central Africa are well known for their superior horse breeds. By organizing their breeders and expanding their training schemes they can further push their renown in this field.
